'''Mantyke''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''タマンタ''' ''Tamanta'') is a dual-type {{2t|Water|Flying}} [[baby Pokémon]] introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Mantine}} when [[level]]ed up with a {{p|Remoraid}} in the [[party]].

==Biology==
Mantyke resembles a {{wp|manta ray}}. It has a round body with wide, flat fins. Its back is dark blue, while its underside is light blue. There are two red spots with white outlines and a light blue, curved line on its back. These markings give the overall impression of a smiling face and vary slightly in each region. It has two long, curving antennae on top of its head and black eyes with eyelash-like markings underneath. The antennae are used to sense ocean currents. Mantyke is a friendly Pokémon that can be found approaching boats and swimming near the ocean's surface with schools of Remoraid.

==In the anime==
[[File:Jack Walker Mantyke.png|thumb|left|250px|Mantyke in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Mantyke debuted in ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea]]''. [[Jack Walker]] used the [[Capture Styler]] on it in order to use it to help him reach the temple. It was also shown swimming with a {{p|Mantine}}. Multiple Mantyke also appeared in the same movie. They briefly reappeared in a montage in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'', which chronicled the preceding nine movies.

Multiple Mantyke appeared in ''[[DP112|Cheers on Castaways Isle!]]'', where they were carrying chunks of grey rocks on their back upriver to help a {{p|Deoxys}}.

===Minor appearances===
A Mantyke appeared in ''[[DP001|Following A Maiden's Voyage!]]'' during the beginning narration of the episode.

A Mantyke appeared in ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]''. {{Ash}} used it in the second leg of the [[Pokémon Triathlon]].

A Mantyke appeared in ''[[DP171|Dawn of a Royal Day!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Coordinator}} who used it in the [[Contest Battle|Battle Stage]] of the {{to|Arrowroot}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

==In the manga==
[[File:Swimmer Mantyke Adventures.png|thumb|left|Mantyke in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Trainer's Mantyke appeared in ''[[PS417|Leaping Past Lopunny]]'' and ''[[PS418|Deprogramming Porygon-Z]]''.

A Mantyke appeared in ''[[PS454|All About Arceus III]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A Mantyke appeared in a fantasy in ''[[DPA03|The Mystery Boy, Jun!!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Mantyke is the only Pokémon that requires a specific Pokémon ({{p|Remoraid}}) to be in the [[party]] in order to evolve it.
* Mantyke has the highest base {{stat|Special Defense}} stat of all unevolved Pokémon and of all [[baby Pokémon]].
* At 3'03" (1.0 m), Mantyke is the tallest [[baby Pokémon]].
* Mantyke is the only [[baby Pokémon]] with a {{t|electric|double weakness}}.
* Mantyke is tied with [[Ledyba]] for having the lowest base {{stat|Attack}} of all {{type|Flying}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
Mantyke is based on a baby {{wp|manta ray}}.

====Name origin====
Mantyke is a combination of ''{{wp|manta ray|manta}}'' and ''tyke'' (slang for ''child'').

Tamanta is a combination of 玉 ''tama'' (egg) and ''manta''.
